name: Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The contractor shall be responsible for engaging a licensed surveyor of Australia approved by the Superintendent to set out all works in accordance with the design drawings prior to the commencement of the works

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - RSA shall provide Senex with a copy of QA documentation that demonstrates compliance with material properties of each unit outlined in the SOW prior to commencing the work.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - No material will be excavated until a joint survey of the existing surface has been performed by the contractor and the client.
2 - Clear and Grub and Topsoil Strip
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Extent of clearing and grubbing to be confirmed with Senex. Roots and vegetation cleared shall be stockpiled at a location specified in the ESC plan
Applicable Spec/Doc Ref - OPS-MIMP-CN- SOW-0009_1-MIMP Civil Earthwors Construction SoW

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Application of gypsum before topsoil strip (0.5kg/m2/100mm layer). 150mm of Topsoil shall be stripped such that all organic-rich soil and roots/ rootlets have been removed from the foundation of the embankment and internal borrow areas.

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Topsoil is to be placed in a loose, non-compacted state, to a maximum height of 3 metres, with batter slopes no greater than 1v:6H. The stockpile area must be clear of earthworks, drainage structures, obstructions, and other permanent works and must be free draining. Stripped topsoil shall be stockpiled where directed by the superintendent for reuse.
○ Weed-contaminated soil is to be separated from non-contaminated soil stockpiles to prevent cross-contamination.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - As-constructed survey has been completed to record the surface levels on completion of topsoil stripping.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The top 150mm below foundation surface level shall be scarified, watered, and compacted to a density ratio of not less than 100% of SMDD to AS 1289.5.1.1.
○ Inspection being conducted befor proof rolling

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The contractor shall proof roll the entire exposed foundation surface within 24 hours of ground surface treatment to identify any soft or loose material. Proof rolling shall be undertaken with a fully loaded water cart or similar equipment, which has a minimum ground bearing pressure of 400 kPa.
○ The rear axle of the fully laden water truck shall be loaded to at least 8.0 tonnes and fitted with dual tyres.
○ Areas of subgrade identified by the superintendent as unsuitable material shall be excavated and replaced with material conforming to the requirements of the overlying fill zone
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Survey of the excavated foundation surface shall be undertaken prior to placement of general fill.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Location of works identified by the project technical specification.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Foundation preparation works completed in the underlying lot.
○ 4.75mm sieve passing - 40-100 % 0.425mm sieve passing - 20-95 % 0.075mm sieve passing - 10-85 %
○ Indicator Requirements Plasticity plots: above the 'A'- line Weighted Plasticity Index - <3200 Emersion Crumb: ≥ 3
○ Moisture content: Moisture conditioned at or near OMC

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Compaction trials must be undertaken to assess the equipment and work methods which will achieve the necessary moisture content and compaction requirements. The trials must be continued until at least four out of every five consecutive tests taken conform to the specification in respect of grading, moisture content, and relative density.

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Placed in continuous, approximately horizontal layers for the full width of the area, under level 1 supervision in layers not exceeding 250mm loose depth. If the surface of any layer is smooth, it must be scarified to a depth of approximately 30 to 50 mm before the placement of the next layer.
○ Each layer of general fill material must be compacted with equipment determined appropriate by compaction trials, or as approved by the Senex representative.

○ Adjacent to structures, pipes, and other services, the operation of heavy mobile equipment must be restricted. In such instances, special compaction using mechanical tampers or other equivalent methods as approved by the Engineer must be adopted.
○ ≥ 100 % standard MDD placed as near as OMC Under level 1 supervision

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The contractor shall proofroll the general fill layer to identify any soft or loose material. Proof rolling shall be undertaken with a fully loaded water cart or similar equipment, which has a minimum ground bearing pressure of 400 kPa. The rear axle of the fully laden water truck shall be loaded to at least 8.0 tonnes and fitted with dual tyres.
○ Areas of general fill layer identified by the superintendent as unsuitable shall be excavated and replaced with material conforming to the requirements of the overlying fill zone
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The contractor should carry out a general survey of the finished general fill layer.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Location of works identified by the project technical specification.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The gravel used should be of Type 2.3

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The contractor shall proofroll the general fill layer to identify any soft or loose material. Proof rolling shall be undertaken with a fully loaded water cart or similar equipment, which has a minimum ground bearing pressure of 400 kPa. The rear axle of the fully laden water truck shall be loaded to at least 8.0 tonnes and fitted with dual tyres.
○ Areas of general fill layer identified by the superintendent as unsuitable shall be excavated and replaced with material conforming to the requirements of the overlying fill zone

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Placed in continuous, approximately horizontal layers for the full width of the area, under level 1 supervision in layers not exceeding 250mm loose depth by AS3798. If the surface of any layer is smooth, it must be scarified to a depth of approximately 30 to 50 mm before the placement of the next layer.
○ Each layer of general fill material must be compacted with equipment determined appropriate by compaction trials, or as approved by the Senex representative.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Hard stand should be tested for material characteristics and compaction.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Finished levels checked for vertical and horizontal tolerances as required.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Location of works identified by the project technical specification.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The finished trimmed surface shall be inspected by the Senex prior to topsoil placement.

Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The finished trimmed surface shall be cross-ripped to 200mm. Topsoil shall be ameliorated with agricultural gypsum (MRTS 16b) at 10kg/loose m3 or 1kg/m2/100mm layer of soil OR (10t/ha/100mm).
○ The gypsum mixing methodology should be submitted to the Senex representative for approval.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Finished surface should be ameliorated with fertilizer at 2.5kg/100m2.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Topsoil within existing stockpiles shall be verified prior to topsoil placement to estimate the volume.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Topsoil shall be spread to a minimum thickness of 150mm.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The finished surfaces are to be stabilised by seeding using quality organic conditioner hydromulch with seed or compost at 12mm thick with seed.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Location of works identified by the project technical specification.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - Fabric, Fabrick reinforcement and support posts should be installed according to the technical specification
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - A 200 to 250mm jute, coir, or straw roll should be installed after discussing with the Senex representative.
Acceptance Criteria / Frequency - The finished surface shall be inspected by the Senex representative prior to the placement of BIDIMA34 geotextile.
○ The dumped rock using should be D50=200MM.
○ Plasticity density : ≥ 2.6 t/m3 Water absorption: ≤ 2.0 % LAV : ≤ 35 %
To be completed upon completion of all work activities

This is to confirm that the above ITP has been completely signed off. All necessary inspections have been completed, the verifying documents have been provided, and the works conform to the contract specification
